viewServicePrompt: Enter service name to view details:
title: CYBORGSHELL CONFIGURATOR
serviceDetailsDescription:
Configure connection details for services.
Example: 'openai' service requires: apikey, endpoint, model
providerSaved: Provider saved. The %%PROVIDERNAME%% provider is configured to use the %%SERVICENAME%% service.
providerDescription:
Providers link CyborgShell components to services:

Examples:
  - 'ai' provider for chatgpt.js handler
  - 'chatgpt' provider for chatgpt.xfrm transformer
  - 'translate' provider for translate.xfrm transformer

You can configure which services each provider uses so you can optimise each type of task such as problem solving or translation.
Provider configuration files are named config-<provider name>-provider.
pressEnterKeep: Press Enter to keep current value
handlerSaved: Handler saved. The %%HANDLERNAME%% handler is configured to be %%HANDLER%%.js.
handlerDescription:
Handlers change the behaviour of CyborgShell. The ! command uses the 'ai' handler.
You can configure the 'ai' handler for example, to use the chatgpt (js) handler or create your own handler.
Handler configuration files are named config-<handler name>-handler.
enterChoice: Enter your choice (1-6, B, D) or press Enter to exit:
deployDescription: Deploy csconfig.json from your current space to your local storage.
deployComplete: Deployed %%COUNT%% configuration items to local storage.
deleteServicePrompt: Enter service name to delete config for:
backupWarning: WARNING: Avoid using this in 'public' space (may expose API keys)
backupDescription: Export all CyborgShell configuration to 'csconfig.json' file.
backingUp: Backing up all configuration to csconfig.json...
autorunDescription: You can configure a program to autorun every time you reset CyborgShell.
aboutToDeploy: About to deploy to local storage. Continue? (Y/N)
aboutToDelete: About to delete all config for [%%SERVICENAME%%]. Continue? (Y/N)
aboutToBackup: About to backup your configuration from local storage. Continue? (Y/N)
